meanings.definition: A disagreeable physical aftereffect from the use of drugs (as alcohol)
meanings.sent1: After a night of drinking, he woke up with a terrible hangovers.
meanings.sent2: She always regrets drinking too much when she has hangovers the next day.
meanings.sent3: His hangovers were a reminder to drink more water next time.
meanings.sent4: The hangovers of his wild night lingered like a dark cloud over his morning.
meanings.sent5: The pounding headache and nausea made the hangovers unbearable.

meanings.definition: Something that remains from what is past
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was a hangovers of a once-thriving town.
meanings.sent2: Memories can be like hangovers, lingering long after the event has passed.
meanings.sent3: The old photo albums were a delightful hangovers of family vacations.
meanings.sent4: The dusty attic held hangovers of forgotten treasures from generations past.
meanings.sent5: The ruins of the ancient city were haunting hangovers of a glorious civilization.
